text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 25.15.9 has been revised to consolidate and update information, including correcting technical errors discovered since last publishing.
MATERIAL CHANGES
IRM 25.15.9.1 - incorporated applicable internal control information, title changed to “Program Scope and Objectives” and included information from prior version of 25.15.9.1.
IRM 25.15.9.3.1.1 - corrected information regarding Posting Delay Codes
IRM 25.15.9.3.2.3(2) - made instruction to update IDRS control more general.
IRM 25.15.9.3.2.4(2) - made instruction to update IDRS control more
IRM 25.15.9.5(3) b) - clariﬁed that joint payment eligible for refund must be made after the innocent spouse request for relief is ﬁled.
25.15.9-1 - removed as obsolete or inapplicable, and renumbered remaining exhibits.
Minor editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Website addresses, legal references and IRM references were reviewed and updated as needed.
ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

) Purpose: IRM

contains instructions for the Cincinnati Centralized Innocent Spouse Operation (CCISO) for processing innocent spouse cases after a request for relief is fully allowed, partially allowed, or disallowed. In addition, this IRM includes instructions for processing cases after a request innocent spouse relief is determined to be non-qualifying. See IRM Non-Qualifying Claims and Complex Account Issues, for more information. (
) Audience: Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) Division employees in CCISO processing ﬁnal determinations of innocent spouse relief on accounts. (
) Policy Owner: The innocent spouse program is under the jurisdiction of the SB/SE Division Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy. (
) Program Owner: The program owner is SB/SE Campus Exam and Field Support. (
) Program Goals: The program goals are to timely and accurately process
, Request for Innocent Spouse Relief, determinations. (

, Relief from Joint and Several on Joint Return, and CFR Title
, Subtitle A – Income Taxes, IRC
, Treatment of Community Income. (

) All requests for account adjustment(s) and/or refunds will be submitted to CCISO processors on an Innocent Spouse Operations (ISO) Adjustment Request (ISO-AR) with a full TXMOD print of the account attached. (

The following is a list of common terms used in this IRM section:
With regard to innocent spouse relief, the Service determines whether to allow relief in full, in part, or deny relief, based on the application of the facts to the law under IRC
, Relief from joint and several liability on joint return, or under IRC
(c) for relief from Community Property laws.

4 25.15 Relief from Joint and Several Liability Term Description MFT 31 Master ﬁle accounts created to hold separate spousal assess- ments and mirrored joint accounts. Mirroring The process of duplicating a joint account into two MFT 31 accounts, one for each spouse. Processor Tax examiners in CCISO who are responsible for ﬁnal account ad- justments required on innocent spouse relief determinations. PSP Innocent Spouse Coordina- Employee in Planning and tor Special Programs (PSP) in each Area assigned the innocent spouse program. Reason Code The reason code input into ISTS to reﬂect the main reason for partial or full disallowance of a request for relief. Receptacle Any bin, basket, shelf, or other location properly identiﬁed, used by CCISO employees to move cases from one area of the innocent spouse operation to another. Request for Innocent Spouse A Form 8857, Request for Relief, also known as an Innocent Innocent Spouse Relief, or similar Spouse Claim statement submitted by the taxpayer under penalty of perjury, requesting relief from a joint or community property liability. Stage The stage shown on ISTS indicates the status of the request for relief. For instance, Stage 01 indicates the date the request was received by the Service. See IRM 25.15.14, Innocent Spouse Tracking System, for more infor- mation. Technical Services Innocent Reviewers located in SB/SE Spouse Reviewer Technical Services assigned the innocent spouse program, who are responsible for mandatory review of all innocent spouse cases worked by Area Office examiners.

Verify the information on the allocation worksheet(s) matches the infor- mation on the ISO-AR, i.e. tax, withholding, credit transaction codes, penalty codes, and amounts to be adjusted. If there is an underpayment and an understatement, AND partial relief is being granted for each, there will be two allocation worksheets attached to the ISO-AR. There are some circumstances in which an allocation may not be required.
Exception: If the understatement portion is strictly a math error, there not be an allocation worksheet for this amount.

) One of the terms of the offer agreement requires the taxpayer to timely ﬁle returns and timely pay taxes for ﬁve years after the acceptance of the OIC or until the offered amount is paid in full, whichever is longer. Note: The future compliance period (ﬁve years after acceptance of the OIC or until the OIC is paid in full) starts from the TC 780 date.
